title: Intro to Shopify
content:
ContentsIntro to ShopifyWelcome to Shopify! Whether you're starting a new business or moving an existing business to Shopify, you can find out more here.
After you register for a free trial, follow the initial setup guide to start using Shopify. The guide features step-by-step tutorials for the main tasks that you need to complete before you start selling. In addition to the initial setup guide, you can print the setup checklist to track your progress.
If you are moving your store to Shopify, then get started with your store migration today.
 Tip
 To see more videos, visit our YouTube channel.
In this section
Overview
Pricing plans
Getting set up to start selling
Hiring and working with Shopify Partners
Store design checklist
Shopify Launch Check
Shopify Plus plan launch checklist
Shopify POS launch checklist
Shopify Plus plan go live guide
Understanding bots at Shopify

title: Products
content:
ContentsHomeProductsThe Products section in your Shopify admin helps you manage your store's entire product catalog, from basic product setup to advanced customization. There are also automation, AI, and bulk management tools that can help you save time when working on your business's product offerings.
On this pageFeatures of the Products sectionConnections to other Shopify admin sections
Features of the Products section
At minimum, a product in Shopify needs to have only two things: A title and a price. From there, you can add descriptions, images, videos. compare-at prices, inventory levels, variants, tags, metafields, and many other details that help you display and sell your products.
Product details
When you add a product to Shopify, you can configure all the relevant settings for your product:
Title and description: Craft SEO-friendly product names and descriptions using rich text formatting. Avoid duplicate manufacturer descriptions for better search visibility.
Media: Upload images, 3D models, or videos to demonstrate products. Supports desktop and mobile layout adjustments and zoom functionality.
Pricing and inventory: Set base prices, track stock quantities, and manage variant-specific inventory.
For a complete list of details and step-by-step instructions, refer to the product details documentation.
Product management
After you add your products, you can manage them individually or through bulk actions. You can organize them into collections to help apply certain settings to groups of products or display them together on your online store.
Review the following product management actions for more details and instructions:
Adding and updating products
Organizing products into collections
Creating metafields for customized product details
Using product tags to group products
You can also apply certain changes to many products at the same time, such as adjusting prices or changing sales channel visibility using the bulk editor. You can also make changes to your product catalog using CSV files.
Connections to other Shopify admin sections
When your product catalog is set up, there are other areas in your Shopify admin that can reference these products to help set up the rest of your store:
Inventory and variants: Manage stock levels per variant combination (size and color).
Online store menus: Use smart or manual collections to power store menus.
Shipping settings: Create product-based rules for your shipping rates, such as basing them off of product price or weight.
In this section
Adding and updating products
Managing inventory
Product bundles
Purchase options
Digital products
Product details
Variants
Product media
Collections
Creating and selling gift cards
Importing and exporting products
Combined listings
Searching for products and filtering your product list
Managing vendor information
Dropshipping
Temporarily changing your product line
Product analytics overview

title: Order management and fulfillment
content:
ContentsHomeOrder management and fulfillmentOrder fulfillment is the entire workflow of processing, fulfilling, managing, and shipping customer orders from your Shopify store. This involves everything from setting up your shipping configuration to sending packages to customers. Whether you're just starting out or you're managing a complex multi-location business, you need to configure your fulfillment settings to ensure that orders reach customers efficiently and cost-effectively.
Before you can fulfill orders, you need to set up your shipping and order fulfillment settings, including shipping rates, shipping profiles, and fulfillment locations. These settings determine how shipping costs are calculated at checkout and which locations can fulfill orders. You can create flat shipping rates for predictable pricing, use carrier-calculated rates for accurate real-time pricing, or combine both approaches based on your products and shipping zones.
After customers place orders, you can manage and process them from the Orders page in your Shopify admin. The order management workflow includes capturing payments, reviewing order details, printing shipping documents, and preparing items for fulfillment. You can also edit orders, issue refunds, or cancel orders when needed.
You have multiple options for fulfilling orders depending on your business needs. You can fulfill orders individually by handling each order manually, or use bulk fulfillment to process multiple orders at once. For businesses that want to outsource fulfillment, you can work with third-party fulfillment services that integrate with Shopify, or use the Shopify Fulfillment Network for end-to-end logistics support.
To save time and money on shipping, you can buy and print shipping labels directly from your Shopify admin. You can also add shipping insurance to protect valuable shipments and provide peace of mind for both you and your customers.
If your customer wants to return or exchange items, then you can create and process returns and exchanges directly in your Shopify admin.
In this section
Setting up shipping and order fulfillment
Managing orders
Fulfilling orders
Fulfillment Network
Getting started shipping with Shopify
Overview of order fulfillment and shipping features on Shopify
